intro: Hieracium flexicaule, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium flexicaule is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
